alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Hopkins; McLean; Webster (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 03 at 1:53PM EST until March 03 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Spencer County in southwestern Indiana... Warrick County in southwestern Indiana... Daviess County in northwestern Kentucky... Hopkins County in northwestern Kentucky... McLean County in northwestern Kentucky... Webster County in northwestern Kentucky... * Until 300 PM CST. * At 1253 PM CST, trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of up to 1 inch is possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Evansville, Owensboro, Madisonville, Newburgh, Providence, Dawson Springs, and Calhoun. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
